    Sample Spaces

    The Sample Space

    Sample space objects can be used to encode the feasible space of binary two-stage designs for optimization.

    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.SampleSpace — Type.
    SampleSpace

    Defines restrictions on the sample space of a two-stage design to be used during optimization.

    source
    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.interimsamplesizerange — Method.
    interimsamplesizerange(ss::SampleSpace)

    Return integer vector of valid $n_1$ values.

    source
    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.maxsamplesize — Method.
    maxsamplesize(ss::SampleSpace)

    Return maximal overal sample size as integer.

    source
    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.maxsamplesize — Method.
    maxsamplesize(
  ss::SampleSpace{TI,TR}, n1::TI2
) where {TI<:Integer,TR<:Real,TI2<:Integer}

    Return maximal sample size given n1 as integer.

    source
    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.isgroupsequential — Method.
    isgroupsequential(ss::SampleSpace)

    Indicate whether the sample space is restricted to group-sequential designs.

    source
